page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO CRANAGE
page.content: Cranage has always been an important area for travellers and is mentioned in the original Domesday Book as a stopping place for rest and refreshment. Now the A54 to Buxton in the east and Chester in the west, and the A50 to the north and south run through the block. More important now is the M6 which divides the block into east and west. It has provided a major link with the north and south and there is a major junction with the A54 at Junction 18 (almost in the centre of the block). There is a very low population due to the extent of farmland covering the area. Most housing is located at the easterly side near to Holmes Chapel. Here the land rises slightly away from the River Dane. The river divides the area into north and south.
